original: Bergström, Richard Carl Gustaf, konsul, Sthlm o. Väriing, f. 7/1/84 i Sthlm. G. 32 m. skriftst. o. ton-sätt. Marianne Stuart. — Stud:ex., kompl. språkstud. Föret, resor i ett tiotal olika europ. länder. Kammar skr. i tuiilv. 08, tjänistförrättande tullinsp. i Dalarö 13-14, Venezuelas konsul i Sthlm 39. Medk av Svensk-Engeltska fören., Ungerska sällsk., Amerikanska sällsk., KSSS o. KAK m. fl. Hobbies: litteratur, matematik, astronomi, geo-Ibgi, vänldisåldrairnia, re’sor m. mi. *Bergström, Olof Robert, postmästare, Vara, f. ^ 20i/6/84 i Stora Kil, Värml. 1., av sjökapt. Johan Olof B. o. Mathilda Svanberg. G. 16 m. Anna Wennerström. Barn: Heddy Matilda f. 16, Gull-Ann 18, Barbro Matilda 20. — E. o. postexp. i västra distr. 03, e. bitr. v. järnv iposten där 06, i Sunne 08, tf. postexp. där s. å., postexp. där 09, p0istas’si’st. där 25, för&te dito i Väis^-tervik 30, postmäst. i Grängesberg 32, i Kramfors 34 o. i Vara ’sed. 41. GM nr.
translated:
Bergström, Richard Carl Gustaf, consul, Stockholm and Varberg, born on January 7, 1884 in Stockholm. Married in 1932 to Marianne Stuart, with whom he has written and composed music. Completed high school and language studies. He has traveled to about ten different European countries. Served as Chamber Secretary in 1908, Customs Inspector in Dalarö from 1913-1914, and Venezuelan Consul in Stockholm in 1939. Member of Swedish-British Association, Hungarian Society, American Society, KSSS and KAK. Hobbies include literature, mathematics, astronomy, geography, world history, and traveling.

Bergström, Olof Robert, postmaster in Vara, born on June 20, 1884 in Stora Kil, Värmland. Son of sea captain Johan Olof B. and Mathilda Svanberg. Married in 1916 to Anna Wennerström, and has three daughters: Heddy Matilda born in 1916, Gull-Ann born in 1918, and Barbro Matilda born in 1920. Started working as mail clerk in 1903 and worked his way up to become postmaster in Vara in 1941.

structured.name: Richard Carl Gustaf Bergström
structured.description: Richard Carl Gustaf Bergström was a Swedish consul, born on January 7, 1884 in Stockholm. He was married to Marianne Stuart and had a career in customs and diplomacy. He was also a member of various organizations and had hobbies in literature, mathematics, astronomy, geography, world history, and traveling. His father was Johan Olof Bergström, a sea captain, and his mother was Mathilda Svanberg. Richard had three daughters: Heddy Matilda, Gull-Ann, and Barbro Matilda. One of his daughters married a postmaster in Vara where Richard had also spent some of his career in the postal service.
